SEARCH
Package org.douggschwind.games.cardgames.common

Class StandardDeckCardGame

java.lang.Object
org.douggschwind.games.cardgames.common.StandardDeckCardGame
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClassicEuchre, TexasHoldEm, Western, WildCardGame
public abstract class StandardDeckCardGame extends Object
An instance of this class assumes one standard deck of 52 total cards, four suits of 13 distinct cards each.

    • determinePlayerHandStrength

      public HandStrength determinePlayerHandStrength(Player player)
      This method determines the strength of the players hand ignoring the possibility of any wild cards.
      Parameters:
      player - Must be non-null.
      Returns:
      Will be non-null.

    • determinePlayerHandsStrength

      public final Map<Player,HandStrength> determinePlayerHandsStrength()

    • determineLeadingPlayersBasedUponHandRankAlone

      protected final Set<Player> determineLeadingPlayersBasedUponHandRankAlone(Map<Player,HandStrength> playerHandStrengths)
      Determines the Player or Players that have the strongest hand.
      Parameters:
      playerHandStrengths - Must be non-null.
      Returns:
      The Set will be non-null and non-empty, and most often only house a single Player. However, there are times when hand rank alone cannot be used to determine the winner of a hand, such as when the two best hands are a Ten high Straight.

    • canPlayersHandHoldTiebreakerCards

      protected abstract boolean canPlayersHandHoldTiebreakerCards(HandStrength playerHandStrength)
      Each game must implement this as certain hands in certain games are unique, but not necessarily in all other games. e.g. In Western, a Four of a Kind hand is unique enough, the other card in the player's hand will not be used to determine the winner of a given hand. In DeucesWild, two players can have the same Four of a Kind, so the fifth card in each player's hand in that case will be used to attempt to determine which player won the hand.
      Parameters:
      playerHandStrength - Expected to be non-null.
      Returns:
      true if so, false otherwise.

    • determineWinners

      public final Set<Player> determineWinners()
      Determine the winners of the hand. There will always be at least one, but in rare cases, two or more players could have equally strong hands in which case those matching hands tie.
      Returns:
      Will be non-null, and contain at least one Player.
